parameters: \pop[2]I enter Isaac's store, and I'm immediately taken aback by how fancy it is.
\pop[2]The massive \c[23]Argus Corporation\c[0] logo at the back is kind of blinding, though...
\pop[2]In spite of that, I make my way toward it; and closer to Isaac.
\pop[2]He stands behind the register, lost in thought. But I could tell he was tired.
\pop[2]That's why I have his boxed lunch in my hands. He forgot it at home, and I wasn't busy.
\pop[2]It was a pretty harmless delivery, all things considered. I'm sure it'd make him happy.
\pop[2]Upon seeing me, his ears immediately perk up, and the appearance of stress melts away.
\pop[6]The only thing worse than working, is working on an empty stomach.
I \c[14]promise\c[0] it won't happen again. I'm not normally forgetful like this.
\i[5]"No problem. You can always count on me."
\i[2]"I'll take any excuse I can get to spend time with you."
\i[4]"Just make sure it doesn't happen again."
\i[6]"Didn't realize I moved here just to be your courier."
\i[0]"I'll never find a job, with distractions like this..."
\i[5]"No problem. You can always count on me."
\pop[6]Good to know! But I still won't make a habit out of it.
\pop[6]Asking for favors isn't my strong suit, so I never know what to give in return.
The party plans are making progress, though. So maybe that's a good start?
\i[2]"I'll take any excuse I can get to spend time with you."
\pop[6]Whoa, subtle. Dante must be rubbing off on you.
\pop[6]I don't know if that's a good thing or a bad thing, but remember.
Don't flirt unless you plan to follow through with it. No one likes a tease~
\i[4]"Just make sure it doesn't happen again."
\pop[6]Yikes. But fair. It was my mistake, and I should pay for it.
\pop[6]You seem a bit tense, though. Don't worry, I'm gonna help with that.
The plans I have for the weekend are coming together, and it'll be \c[14]tons\c[0] of fun.
\i[6]"Didn't realize I moved here just to be your courier."
\pop[6]Please don't tell anybody about my master plan, Delta.
Just keep up the good work, and I'll make it worth your while.
\i[0]"I'll never find a job, with distractions like this..."
\pop[6]Oh, were you planning to apply around town today?
\pop[6]My bad. I guess I should've asked Dante. He can afford a break.
While you're here, maybe you should go talk to my boss. He's always hiring.
\pop[2]He gives me a soft smile, and turns back toward his computer.
\pop[2]As he faces his work once more, the smirk turns into a grimace.
\pop[2]It was almost like his worries melted away as we spoke. Flattering.
Ten of my installations this month have backfired.
\pop[6]That means the people who bought them made illegal modifications.
Basically, I lose the commission. Normally I don't care, but \c[14]ten\c[0] in a row?
\pop[2]He strokes his chin, like he's lost in thought.
\pop[2]It's odd how he hates when people mod their gear, but he does it all the time.
\pop[2]I decide to ask him more about why. Nobody is around to spy, or anything.
\pop[6]What I do is harmless, and I still follow the terms of service.
These people are actively causing harm. Using the tech to aid in crimes and stuff.
\pop[2]Right. Isaac wouldn't be the type of person to commit a crime.
\pop[6]Besides, \c[23]Argus\c[0] wouldn't care if they found out about my mods.
That's why we have \c[10]zeros\c[0]. You can basically abandon \c[23]The System\c[0] entirely.
\pop[6]So when I mute an AI, or change the colors of lights? It's nothing.
I'd like to think that \c[23]Argus\c[0] has bigger problems. I mean, they clearly do.
\pop[2]Makes sense to me; and now I understand why Isaac's house is so "under-equipped".
\pop[2]Why implement invasive technology in your home if you don't have to, right?
\pop[2]You could stick to the bare minimum. Just enough to satisfy \c[23]Argus\c[0].
They slipped through my fingers, so I enabled their crimes.
\c[23]Argus\c[0] can dock me points for that. Such a stupid rule.
\pop[2]That hardly seems fair. None of this seems to "fit" Isaac either, and it's odd.
\pop[2]A man peddling wares he doesn't support, or even use in his own life?
\pop[2]Willingly giving \c[23]Argus\c[0] eyes and ears everywhere, except his own home?
\pop[2]I vocalize these thoughts, and he shrugs.
\pop[6]A job is a job. That's what I always say.
\pop[6]Besides, it could never hurt to stay on \c[23]Argus\c[0]' good side.
Climb the ladder, and you won't be there when they tip it over.
\pop[6]I like working around people, too; and I mostly sell phones anyway.
\pop[6]Big-scale installations like vehicles and home security are few and far between.
Can't argue with selling a kid their first phone, though. Connecting them to the world.
\pop[2]That's fair. I'd be a bit conflicted if I were in his situation, though.
\pop[2]\c[23]Argus\c[0] has never done anything wrong, but they're still feared by a portion of the world.
\pop[2]Working for them could be seen as working for the enemy by a lot of people.
\pop[2]\c[23]Argus\c[0] is so secretive about everything they do, it's hard not to theorize.
\pop[2]It could be solved by some more transparency, but they're never willing to offer that.
\pop[2]Something about a mysterious corporation running the world seems to strike more obedience.
\pop[6]Come on. I promise not to scroll through your gallery.
\pop[2]I shrug, and hand him my phone.
\pop[2]I'm glad that I upgraded last month. Isaac seems to notice my brand new model.
\pop[2]He looks around the store, to make sure nobody is watching.
\pop[2]Then, a second later, he runs the phone along some sort of scanning device.
\pop[2]He throws my phone back at me. Thankfully, I catch it.
\pop[6]Rule number one. Never hand over your phone.
\pop[6]Even if it's someone you trust, it's just not worth it.
One simple scan, and I can do almost anything I want.
\pop[6]I could put your info on a new phone. Impersonate you online.
I could even overwrite the info on your current phone. Change your identity.
\pop[6]But I'd never do anything like that. \c[14]Probably\c[0].
\pop[2]Before I can do anything, he starts laughing.
I'd never mess around with important stuff like that.
\pop[6]I did a few things that might help you out while you look for a job, though.
Play along with what I'm about to say. I need an excuse for the computer.
\pop[2]He clears his throat, and starts using an acting voice, like he's playing a part.
\pop[6]Terribly sorry for the inconvenience. \c[23]Argus\c[0] values you more than that.
\pop[6]The next six months of all \c[23]Argus\c[0] related subscription services are on the house.
And not only that, but all \c[23]Argus\c[0]-associated venues will be twenty percent off.
\pop[6]Is there anything else I can do for you at this juncture?
\pop[2]He winks at me, and I'm not sure what to do, or how to take what just happened.
\pop[2]I appreciate the gesture, but there's no way what he just did was "allowed".
\pop[2]He said he'd never break the law, though. I trust him, despite the anxiety.
\pop[2]There's no telling what may come from this...
\pop[2]I just wanted to do a good deed, and now I feel immoral.
\pop[2]Completing the opposite of what I desired, I leave Isaac with his meal.
\pop[2]Maybe we'd have time to talk about this later...
